solution_line_template: Anna bought {num_gum_packs} packs of chewing gum that were ${cost_per_gum_pack} each for a total of {num_gum_packs}*{cost_per_gum_pack}=$<<{num_gum_packs}*{cost_per_gum_pack}={cost_gum}>>{cost_gum}

Anna bought {num_chocolate_bars} chocolate bars that were ${cost_per_chocolate_bar} each for a total of {num_chocolate_bars}*{cost_per_chocolate_bar}=$<<{num_chocolate_bars}*{cost_per_chocolate_bar}={cost_chocolate}>>{cost_chocolate}

Anna bought {num_candy_canes} large candy canes that were ${cost_per_candy_cane} each for a total of {num_candy_canes}*{cost_per_candy_cane} =$<<{num_candy_canes}*{cost_per_candy_cane}={cost_candy_canes}>>{cost_candy_canes}
Anna had ${initial_money} to start and spent ${total_spent} so she had ${initial_money}-${total_spent} = $<<{initial_money}-{total_spent}={money_left}>>{money_left} left
